item.title: Report E-2023080565
item.description:
Report E-2023080565

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: CAMBRIDGE CITY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 2, 2023, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1760 was damaged in transit due to improper loading and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted surfaces. ISR utilized a forklift to off load the trailer. The crew deployed absorbents to the released material and utilized hand tools to collect the impacted solids. All waste was contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum. ISR contained the old tote and drum for transport and disposal. The new tote remained on the trailer.

item.title: Report X-2023080320
item.description:
Report X-2023080320

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release we found during sort operations at the INDH facility. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans and one of the cans was bent on the side causing the lid to open. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration is needed for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023070453
item.description:
Report X-2023070453

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 14th a drum was discovered dented with a small leak. The drum contained UN3082, Environmentally Hazardous Substance, 9, III. The spill was cleaned up and the drum was able to be placed into a steel salvage drum. The shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration.
